header.gameNote: Southland Men's Tournament - Semifinals AT KATY TX

article.headline: Texas-Arlington 72, Sam Houston St. 66
article.story: KATY, Texas (AP) -- Anthony Vereen scored 20 points to lead Texas-Arlington to a 72-66 win over Sam Houston State in the semifinals of the Southland Conference tournament Friday night. Rog'er Guignard added 17 points, eight rebounds and four assists for the seventh-seeded Mavericks, who will make their fourth appearance in the SLC tournament finals Sunday. Texas-Arlington (20-11) has never won the tournament. The Mavericks shot 50 percent from the field and went 7-of-16 on 3-pointers, including 5-of-9 from Guignard. Sam Houston (23-8), the third seed, was led by forward Ryan Bright's 19 points and 13 rebounds, his second double-double in as many tournament games. Post John Gardiner added 12 points for the Bearkats, who shot 41 percent, including 9-of-25 from 3-point range. Sam Houston led 40-37 at half before Texas-Arlington went on an 18-2 run to start the second half. Sam Houston was within three at 69-66 with 13.8 seconds left, but Texas-Arlington sealed the game on free throws.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
